name: my_documentation
description: A basic necessity for most http servers is to be able to serve static files. Thankfully, it is not that hard to do in Node.js. In my project I used the path requested and it serves that path, relative to the local directory. This works fine as a quick solution. However, when loading the address http: // localhost: 3000 through the local Node.js server that I installed, the files that should be loaded through it are not loaded.
author: Nazym
